name: Jordan curve
rephrased: A simple closed curve divides the plane into two regions: an interior and an exterior.
implication_form: If a curve is a simple closed curve in the plane, then it divides the plane into two regions.
explained: The Jordan curve theorem states that every simple closed curve in the plane divides the plane into two regions: one bounded interior region and one unbounded exterior region, and the curve itself is the boundary between them. More formally, if J is a Jordan curve (a continuous, simple closed curve, i.e., a homeomorphism from the circle S¹ to R²), then R²\J is disconnected and has exactly two connected components: one bounded and one unbounded.
